item.title: The Event Loop of Node.js
item.description: The Event Loop of Node.js The event loop is a fundamental concept in Node.js that enables non-blocking I/O operations, despite JavaScript being single-threaded. Hereâ€™s a high-level overview of how it works: Initialization: When Node.js starts, it initializes the event loop and processes the input script, which may include asynchronous API calls, timer scheduling, or process.nextTick() calls. Phases of the Event Loop: Timers: This phase executes callbacks scheduled by setTimeout() and setInterval().
